column1: A resource centre for children with disabilities and their families
• What services are there at the Centre?
• Who can use the service?
• How to make a comment, compliment or complaint

Garden Avenue is a resource centre for children with disabilities and their families. It is your community building where we hope you will feel welcome and able to use the services and facilities. For example, we have a play room, a toy lending library and information library. We hope that the Centre will continue to develop with your help.
What services are there at the Centre?
The Children with Disabilities Service is based here. The service includes:
• Assessment and Care Management Team: we work directly with families to look at your needs and identify appropriate services where needed.
• Family Link Scheme provides short breaks for children with disabilities.
• Record of Children with disabilities - we maintain the Record as well as providing information including a newsletter to children and their families.
• Inclusive play and leisure scheme - we promote play schemes, holiday clubs, sporting activities and befriending projects for children with disabilities.

We hope that in the future other agencies involved in providing services to children with disabilities will play a greater part in the Centre. For example, we hope that relevant agencies will hold advice surgeries and talks on specific issues.

If you are a child with a disability we want you and your family to make full use of the facilities. If you would like to use any of the Centre's rooms and library, please ask the staff for more details. They'll be happy to help.

The Snoezelen® Room is a magical place filled with special lights, soft soothing music, a variety of textures, mirrors and sounds. The floors and walls are cushioned and there are special chairs that you can sink into while the lights and sounds surround you.
A Snoezelen® Room is a place of relaxation, pleasure and pure enjoyment. Anyone who enters can decide to explore and enjoy the different sensory experiences in their own way and in their own time.
Some of the items you will find in the room include:
Bubble tubes, a soft slide and steps, a ball pool, fibre optics, a visual projector, soft play equipment, a musical vibration chair and lots more to stimulate a person's senses.

Families can use this room to meet other families and children with disabilities enabling the WHOLE family to relax and enjoy the facilities. There is easy access to toys, books, tv/video, pc/games consoles and the Snoezelen® room as well as outdoor play areas. There are also kitchen facilities, disabled toilets and shower room/changing facilities.

Members can borrow from a selection of high quality toys from our lending collection. To join the lending library please contact the children with disabilities team for a membership form or drop into the centre.

The toy selection enhances motor, social, sensory, cognitive and imaginative skills as well as language skills. To achieve this our collection includes: role playing games, building blocks, musical instruments, puzzles, puppets, arts and crafts, rattles, children's books and much more.
There is an extensive library of leaflets and information on diagnosis, services, charity organisations, benefits, holiday facilities and much more.

Parents can also use the internet to find information and we have a database of national organisations and charities for you to use. We will do our best to answer your inquiries. Sometimes we may refer you to other organisations that may be able to help. Please note that although we can put you in contact with welfare benefits agencies, we cannot offer welfare benefits advice ourselves.

The large conference room can be booked for support group meetings or professional meetings. There are facilities to make coffee and tea and prepare buffets. Equipment such as an overhead projector is available.

We need your help to develop the service to meet the needs of children with disabilities. Your feedback and ideas are important to us. If you would like to become more involved with helping us to develop the service, please contact the team.
Children who have a disability and their families can use the service. For an informal chat or to find out more information, please contact a member of the team.
You may prefer to make an appointment online.
We are open Monday to Wednesday 8.30am - 5.00pm | Thursday 8.30am - 4.30pm | Friday 8.30am - 4.00pm
As the Centre develops we hope that we may be able to extend the opening hours.
